frame.name: Behind_the_scenes
frame.definition: <def-root><fen>Artist</fen>s work at various tasks that further the completion of a film, play, television show, or other similar <fen>Production</fen>. <fen>Artist</fen>s never appear on stage or in front of a camera. Some (e.g., a director) may interact with the actors (on-screen participants) of the <fen>Production</fen>. Often times a particular <fen>Production</fen> is made for distribution by a <fen>Distributor</fen>, by a particular <fen>Studio</fen>, or in a specific <fen>Medium</fen>. The <fen>Artist</fen>s may be categorized into <fen>Type</fen> or work in specific <fen>Medium</fen>. <ex><fex name="Artist">Steven Spielberg</fex> <t>directed</t> <fex name="Production">several films</fex> <fex name="Studio">for Universal Pictures</fex>.</ex> <ex><fex name="Studio">Universal Pictures and Amblin Entertainment</fex> <t>produced</t> <fex name="Production">Jurassic Park</fex> <fex name="Distributor">for MCA</fex>.</ex> <ex>Surprisingly, this <fex name="Medium">film</fex> <fex name="Artist"><t>producer</t></fex> was willing to work for a cable company.</ex> <ex><fex name="Type">Independent</fex> <fex name="Artist"><t>producers</t></fex> often win big at smaller film festivals.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Artist
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Artist</fen> works off-stage to help make the <fen>Production</fen>. <ex><fex name="Artist">John Williams</fex> <t>composed</t> the soundtrack to Star Wars.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Production
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Production</fen> is the final product put out by the off-stage (and on-stage) participants. <ex>Ralph Smith <t>produced</t> <fex name="Prod">the off-Broadway hit "Why Is My Name Ralph?"</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Type
FE.definition: <def-root>An <fen>Artist</fen> may be categorizedy by <fen>Type</fen>. <ex><fex name="Type">Hollywood</fex> <t>director</t></ex> <ex><fex name="Type">independent</fex> <t>film-maker</t></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Distributor
FE.definition: <def-root>Often (especially with film or television) the <fen>Production</fen> is advertised and transmitted to the audience by the <fen>Distributor</fen>. <ex>Even desperate producers would never <t>produce</t> a film <fex name="Dist">for that television station</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Studio
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE indicates the particular orgainzaion that makes the <fen>Production</fen>. <ex>The latest performance <t>produced</t> <fex name="Studio">by The Umbrella Thesbians</fex> was a major hit in France.</ex> <ex>First layer: <fex name="Studio">New Line Cinema</fex> <t>produces</t> several films each year.</ex> <ex>Second layer: <fex name="Artist">New Line Cinema</fex> <t>produces</t> several films each year.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Medium
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE indicates the <fen>Medium</fen> in which a particular <fen>Artist</fen> works or a <fen>Production</fen> is made. <ex>He <t>produces</t> <fex name="Medium">for television</fex></ex> <ex>She is a <fex name="Medium">theatre</fex> <t>director</t>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE indicates the time when the <fen>Production</fen> is made. <ex>Silence of the Lambs was <t>filmed</t> <fex name="Time">in 1991</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE indicates the location of production. <ex>The documentary was <t>shot</t> <fex name="Place">on location</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Nationality
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE indicates the <fen>Nationality</fen>, ethnicity, or primary working location of the <fen>Artist</fen>. <ex>Several <fex name="Nationality">Canadian</fex> <t>directors</t> have received attention from critics in recent years.</ex> <ex><fex name="Nationality">Local</fex> <t>film-makers</t> often collaborate for larger efforts.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Purpose</fen> for which an <fen>Artist</fen> works on a <fen>Production</fen>. <ex>I <t>produced</t> this film <fex name="Purpose">to let people know what I went through as a child</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Performer
FE.definition: <def-root>In screen performances, the <fen>Performer</fen> is filmed as he or she acts out a role with respect to the larger <fen>Production</fen> <ex>This particular scene was <t>shot</t> <fex name="Perf">with a local choir and dancers</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Score
FE.definition: <def-root>The music which may be performed in the performance of the <fen>Production</fen>, either in isolation or accompanying actions and speech.</def-root>

FE.name: Scene
FE.definition: <def-root>A <fen>Scene</fen> is a sub-part of a larger production. In film, scenes are sometimes recorded independently, and later edited into the final movie.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: film-maker.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a person who directs or produces films for the cinema or television.

lexUnit.name: director.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a person who directs a film, play, etc.

lexUnit.name: producer.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a person who administers the financial and managerial aspects of a film or broadcast or the staging of a play.

lexUnit.name: direct.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: supervise and control (a film, play, or other production).

lexUnit.name: produce.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: administer the financial and managerial aspects of (a film or broadcast) or the staging of (a play).

lexUnit.name: shoot.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: film or photograph (a scene, film, etc.).

lexUnit.name: film.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: make a film of; record on film.

lexUnit.name: score.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a written representation of a musical composition showing all the vocal and instrumental parts.

lexUnit.name: soundtrack.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the sound accompaniment to a film

lexUnit.name: stage.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: present a performance of (a play or other show).

lexUnit.name: cast.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: select the cast for a performance.
